free_text.Form of examination: 20% active participation[br/]30% mid-term exam[br/]25% projet[br/]25% presentation
free_text.Bibliography and material: Stanford Technology Venture Program, http://stvp.stanford.edu [br/][br/]Founders at Work, Jessica Livingston, Apress, 2007[br/]www.foundersatwork.com [br/][br/]The Art of Start, Guy Kawasaki, Portfolio, 2004[br/]http://www.guykawasaki.com/books/art-of-the-start.shtml [br/][br/]Start-Up, What we may still learn from Silicon Valley, Hervé Lebret, CreateSpace, 2007[br/]www.startup-book.com
free_text.Content: High-tech entrepreneurship has become a major topic of innovation thanks to the value creation of companies such as Microsoft, Intel, Genentech, Apple or Google. Such companies did not exist forty years ago and some of them are merely ten years old. Still, high growth remains somehow a mystery which could not be really replicated (with only a few exceptions) outside of Silicon Valley. Such an exceptional phenomenon will be studied not only through case studies but also through real live cases.[br/][br/]The high failure rate of start-up growth is an indication that even in Silicon Valley entrepreneurship remains a difficult process, not to say that it is nearly impossible to master. No theory has been able to predict the outcome of entrepreneurial ventures and it is not even clear that practice and experience really help in building successful start-ups. Therefore, the only way to better understand startup dynamics is to experience them in real cases. EFPL is surrounded by a higher than average high-tech start-ups, particularly at the Science Park (PSE) and close by Garage. [br/][br/]Students will be given an opportunity to work with entrepreneurs on challenges they face in the start-up growth. Given the limited timeframe, it will not be possible to have a complete overview of the challenges an entrepreneur faces, but the objective would be that the students learn as much as possible from such a situation. Because all start-ups are different however, a large part of the course will be to complement the real case with other case studies so that the students learn as much as possible.[br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: A mix of academic teaching and personal project.
free_text.Learning outcomes: Learn through  real cases the unique features of high-tech entrepreneurship

en.title: Entrepreneurship Laboratory (e-lab)
en.library_recommends:
• "Founders at work [Elektronische Daten] : stories of startups' early days / Jessica Livingston". Year:2007. ISBN:978-1-59059-714-9
  • "Start-up : ce que nous pouvons encore apprendre de la Silicon Valley / Hervé Lebret". Year:2007. ISBN:978-143481733-4
  • "The art of the start : the time-tested, battle-hardened guide for anyone starting anything / Guy Kawasaki". Year:2004. ISBN:1-59184-056-2

free_text.Bibliographie et matériel: Stanford Technology Venture Program, http://stvp.stanford.edu [br/][br/]Founders at Work, Jessica Livingston, Apress, 2007[br/]www.foundersatwork.com [br/][br/]The Art of Start, Guy Kawasaki, Portfolio, 2004[br/]http://www.guykawasaki.com/books/art-of-the-start.shtml [br/][br/]Start-Up, What we may still learn from Silicon Valley, Hervé Lebret, CreateSpace, 2007[br/]www.startup-book.com
free_text.Forme d'enseignement: Mélange d'enseignements académiques et de projet personnel
free_text.Contenu: L'entrepreneuriat high-tech est devenu un sujet primordial de l'innovation et de la création de valeur économique, comme le montre le succès de sociétés telles que Microsoft, Intel, Genentech, Apple or Google qui n'existaient pas il y a 40 ans. Pourtant ce domaine reste assez méconnu et mal compris, du moins en dehors de la Silicon Valley. L'objectif de ce cours est de mieux comprendre ce phénomène par la théorie et la pratique. [br/][br/]Le fort taux d'échec des start-up (même dans la Silicon Valley montre que l'entrepreneuriat est un phénomène complexe et sans doute difficile pour ne pas dire impossible à maîtriser. Aucune théorie n'a pu vraiment faire le tour de la question. Il est donc critique d'expérimenter cette activité à travers des ca réées, tels que ceux existant près de l'EPFL, au PSE ou au Garage. [br/][br/]Les étudiants auront donc l'occasion de travailler avec des entrepreneurs qui font face au défi de la croissance de leur entreprise. Etant donné leur faible niveau de disponibilité, les étudiants doivent avoir conscience des défis auxquels ils feront face eux-mêmes pour tirer le bénéfice maximal de cette expérience. Comme chaque cas est unique, il sera aussi essentiel qu'ils partagent cette expérience avec leurs collègues de cours.[br/]
free_text.Forme du contrôle: 20% participation active[br/]30% examen intermédiaire[br/]25% projet[br/]25% présentation
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Expérimenter à travers des cas réels les caractères uniques de l'entrepreneuriat high-tech
